title: Quiz 3: Principles of Community Health
description: Assess your knowledge of the core principles guiding community health, including the Alma Ata Declaration.

questions.question: What is defined as a basic belief, theory, or rule that has a major influence on the way something is done?
questions.explanation: A principle is a basic belief or rule influencing conduct (Macmillan English Dictionary).

questions.question: Which of the following are principles from the **Alma Ata Declaration (1978)**? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Availability of health care for all

questions.explanation: Alma Ata emphasizes health for all, participation, and inter-sectoral approaches. It integrates curative and preventive, not curative only.

questions.question: According to Hentsch (1985), health care should be shaped around the life patterns of the population.
questions.explanation: Hentsch stated health care should be shaped around life patterns and meet community needs.
questions.hint: Health care must fit the people's lifestyle.

questions.question: Community health nursing services should be available to all regardless of sex, age, ___BLANK___, or economic status.
questions.explanation: Services must be non-discriminatory regarding religion, race, politics, etc.
questions.hint: A system of belief or faith.

questions.question: Which principle emphasizes that community health nursing should NOT be an isolated effort?

options.text: It should be a vertical programme
It should not be a vertical programme

questions.explanation: It should NOT be a vertical programme; it requires collaboration with other stakeholders.
questions.hint: Vertical means standing alone; horizontal involves others.

questions.question: Match the principle concept to its description:

pairs.right: Available to all at affordable cost
Development of maximum potential for self-help

questions.explanation: Inter-sectoral=multiple sectors; Participation=community involved; Equity=fair access; Self-care=independence.
questions.hint: Connect the term to its practical meaning.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a principle of community health nursing?
questions.explanation: Demanding gifts or bribes is unethical and contrary to nursing principles.

questions.question: Community health nursing services should build the capacity of the community to run their own health programs.
questions.explanation: Sustainability requires building community capacity, e.g., training CORPs.

questions.question: According to the principles, where should the majority of health interventions be undertaken?

richContent.content: Quote Context: 'The majority of interventions should be undertaken at the most...'

questions.explanation: Interventions should occur at the most peripheral level (closest to the people) by suitably trained workers.

questions.question: Health education and ___BLANK___ for the individual and family are integral parts of community health nursing.
questions.explanation: Health education and counseling are core components.
